job_title: Undergraduate Student Researcher in University Center, MI
pros: I got good experience in research. Opportunities were provided to present my work. Was a great stepping stone into the world of scientific research.
cons: Low pay. I know the purpose of an undergraduate research program is primarily to provide experience, but it took up a large majority of my time, making it unreasonable to find another job.

review_title: Excellent Academic Achievement Center, Great Co-Workers, and Flexible Schedule.
job_title: Social Science Tutor in Saginaw, MI
pros: The hours were extremely flexible and the Academic Achievement Center Director was very accommodating to my class schedule. I also received lots of amazing feedback from my supervisor as well as my peers, and received a lot of great training. The management style of our director was very laid back and allowed for us to have some creative freedom in how we approached tutoring mentees. Additionally, the work environment was very welcoming, relaxed and all of my coworkers were friendly and helpful from the first day I was there.
cons: Sometimes the documentation system we used would not work properly, making it difficult to track progress of students who were coming to see us. However, they were working on a new way of keeping track of appointments and tracking progress of students online.

job_title: Student Test Proctor in Kochville, MI
pros: Fantastic people to work with. Flexible hours
cons: Low pay is a issue, but it’s a college job what do you expect.

review_title: Narrow-minded, short-sighted, and self-absorbed administration.  Petty!
pros: Was able to function with reasonable autonomy.
cons: Highly politicized environment with decisions made based on who feeds administrative egos rather than what is best for the institution and its students.

pros: Good mid-level management but the administration is out of touch. Good insurance and 401K.
cons: They care about people they like and if they don't like you, good luck. Lots of internal promotion without jobs being posted. Favoritism. They're losing great people because they're overworked and severely underpaid.

job_title: Biology and Chemistry Tutor in Saginaw, MI
pros: My boss was open and willing to work with my school schedule. Pandemic was handled well. Low stress.

job_title: Graduate Mechanical Engineer in Saginaw, MI
pros: My boss is the best i have ever had.
cons: I require full time work.

review_title: Disorganized, treated poorly by management and faculty
pros: Parties, gym membership, nice looking college, good benefits.
cons: Low salary, zero orientation from HR or anyone about mandatory forms/vacation and sick time,  and zero orientation to my position as management weren't organized enough to allow time to orient me. You wouldn't believe the way faculty and managers talk to secretaries or assistants.  I've never seen behavior like this tolerated by upper management before.  I was embarrassed to have my family/friends see me at work due to the way I was treated :(  It was like a nightmare going there every day.  I brought up my concerns to my supervisor several times and was told 'that's just how it is with phd faculty'.

job_title: Stockroom Associate Chemistry Department in Saginaw, MI
pros: I worked in the chemistry department stockroom and the people were fantastic. Those of us in the stockroom held important responsibilities and the professors and students regarded us as such. The boss was also amazing with flexible hours which were easy to trade with other employees. I hated to leave. I had support from others and the ability to make changes for the better in my environment. They were also very flexible with my school and life schedule. It was a great place to work as a student.
cons: As a part time student employee I didn't get raises and made minimum wage.

review_title: Not as good as I would have hoped!
pros: It is a beautiful campus and the people, for the most part, are good people.  The campus has a lot of potential.
cons: The potential for growth is great but the commitment is not there.  There are obstacles to becoming the best and apathy in the administration is overwhelming the university.  They talk of being great but are not committed to being the best.

review_title: The people and benefits are great.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in University Center, MI
pros: I can't stress enough how great the people are. The work environment is more laid back than the private sector. The benefits are great. Time off is hardly ever denied and there is plenty of it. Tuition benefits, medical, dental, etc are awesome as well as work schedule flexibility. In ITS, there are opportunities for training every year.
cons: One of the biggest down sides for working here is the lack of professional development, recognition, and incentive. I was told coming in there was no room for advancement and it was true. The salary could be better.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in University Center, MI
pros: The benefits are excellent and the option to change your work schedule is great.  As an AP staff, you get 15 hours of vacation a month!  Can't beat the 12% the university pays towards your retirement account.
cons: Pay is a little low compared to the private sector, especially if your working in the IT department.  Don't expect to make anywhere close to what you could get at a private company locally.  But, I expect that is because the benefits are so good.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in University Center, MI
pros: Nice place to teach. I taught online classes and the full-time faculty were very supportive when a class I taught needed updating. They helped in get and keep me ontrack in its redesign. The students there make it enjoyable.
cons: Adjunct pay  and benefits could be improved but it is pretty much the same everywhere if you work as an adjunct.  You work on a semester by semester basis and if student enrollment drops in your area full-time faculty may teach the course instead.

review_title: Networking Jobs At SVSU are the best for students!
job_title: Assistant Network Engineer in University Center, MI
pros:
- Flexible hours
- Get to take responsibility (I loved that, I felt like I'm full time employee, and not a student)
- I learned A LOT!
cons: Sometimes, you might do other departments assignments, but it gives you more knowledge about IT experience overall. Networking Team is very well known to be All-In-One team for IT, you get to do Networking, Phones (VOIP), IT Customer Support, Desktop support, and many more.

job_title: Student Graphic Designer in University Center, MI
pros: The SVSU network is tight-knit, but also large. Networking is a huge plus here. I started as a student graphic designer for the University Communications department, and remained there for the length of my college education. The knowledge and experience I gained from my superiors was priceless. My supervisor but me in contact with a company here in Saginaw, and I graduated from SVSU with a job.
cons: None come to mind at the moment.

review_title: Veterans Services at Saginaw Valley State University
job_title: Veterans Affairs Assistant in Saginaw, MI
pros: The Veterans Services at Saginaw Valley State University is a very professional and welcoming place for veteran students to come and find educational assistance, as well as a place to relax and unwind from a hard days work studying.
cons: There are no real cons to working for the Veterans Services at Saginaw Valley State University.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in University Center, MI
pros: I always found them to be fair, with a good work environment. They offer great benefits and time off. Good work/life balance.
cons: There were a lot of office politics. You always have to remember the pecking order.

pros: Great health benefits, more vacation than you can use. Paid time off between Christmas and New Years (university shut down!).
cons: Little chance of advancement in many departments.  Senior management plays favorites.

pros: Flexible Hours and good pay for a college student. ($9 +)
cons: Sometimes students don't understand that tutors are students too. Not some all-knowing deity. We mess up too!
